unnormalised: Hey everyone! Been seeing a lot of posts lately about Yoga, and it got me thinking...it's so much more than just flexible poses, right?
normalised: Hey everyone! Been seeing a lot of posts lately about Yoga, and it got me thinking...it's so much more than just flexible poses, right?

unnormalised: I started practicing yoga about 5 years ago after Dr. Sharma recommended it to me for back pain. Initially, I was skeptical. I mean, I thought it was just for super-bendy people. But honestly, it's been a game-changer.
normalised: I started practicing yoga about five years ago after Doctor Sharma recommended it to me for back pain. Initially, I was skeptical. I mean, I thought it was just for super-bendy people. But honestly, it's been a game-changer.

unnormalised: For me, it’s not just about touching my toes (though I can *almost* do that now!). It's about the breathwork (pranayama), the mindfulness, and that feeling of calm afterwards. I usually do a 30-minute session in my living room (about 150 sq ft), following a YouTube video by a teacher from Rishikesh.
normalised: For me, it’s not just about touching my toes (though I can *almost* do that now!). It's about the breathwork (pranayama), the mindfulness, and that feeling of calm afterwards. I usually do a thirty-minute session in my living room (about one hundred and fifty square feet), following a YouTube video by a teacher from Rishikesh.
